Again, this evening, it's not an exhaustive study, but we find in the book of Proverbs, Proverbs 13, if you will, God gives us a couple of truths here in the book of Proverbs with regard to pride that are important for us to point out this evening as we acknowledge the danger of pride. The Bible tells us here in Proverbs 13 in verse number 10 that pride leads to contention. And we have a lot of contention in our world today. We have a lot of contention in our homes today. Unfortunately, there's contention in our churches today. And we find the Bible tells us in Proverbs 13 in verse number 10, only by pride cometh contention, but the well-advised is wisdom. Pride leads to contention. I'm right, you're wrong. It's my way, not your way. And we find that here, he talks about the source of contention being pride. And we see that so often. And we see that the result of that as it's revealed to us in Proverbs 16 in verse number 18, where the Bible says a familiar verse of scripture, pride goeth before destruction and in haughty spirit before a fall. We see this in the life of Nebuchadnezzar. We see that he's lifted up and look at what I've done. Look at what I've accomplished. Only by pride cometh or pride goeth before destruction.
